Header: New Year celebrations – number of those hospitalised increases
Content: Four hundred and seventy nine (479) patients were admitted to the accident ward of the National Hospital in Colombo as a result of injuries sustained in accidents related to new year celebrations. The netted cover of a building under construction down New Chetty Street in Kochchikade caught fire due to the negligence of a group celebrating the new year with fire-crackers. Deputy Director General of Health Services Dr. Anil Jasinghe says that a higher number of accidents caused due to negligence of those engaged in using firecrackers have been reported this year. News 1st witnessed, first-hand, at the National Hospital in Colombo today, January 1, the consequences of negligence during new year celebrations.
